result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwayne Andrew Gay

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwayne Andrew Gay in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Dwayne Andrew Gay.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Dwayne Andrew Gay appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Dwayne Andrew Gay.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests an additional Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Signed. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.

Defendant Dwayne Andrew Gay in court, via zoom, with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference.   Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Golden, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $70.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference date to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case set for a pre-trial conference on 7/14/22 at 8:30 am. Due to court's calendar, case is rescheduled to 7/21/22 at 1:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.L.P. (8/9/1997)
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dwayne Andrew Gay in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Dwayne Andrew Gay
Current: 2939 East Adams Avenue, #3, Cudahy, WI 53110   (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 2939 East Adams Avenue, #3, Milwaukee, WI 53110
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/22/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6-22-2022 @1p
